info.name: Imburse API
info.description:
Welcome to the Imburse API. You can use our APIs to access Imburse portal and Payment API endpoints. # Authentication To authorize, use this code: ```shell # With shell, you can just pass the correct header with each request $ curl "api_endpoint_here" -H "Authorization: Hmac {token}" ``` Imburse issues API keys to allow access to the API. We issue both `Client API Tokens`, for accessing client functionality, and `Account API Tokens` for accessing the clients' parent account. You can manage your API keys in the Imburse Portal dashboard or via the API. Your API tokens carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secret! Do not share your API `private keys` in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, and so forth. All API requests must be made over `HTTPS`. API requests without authentication will fail. ## HMAC Authentication Each request made to Imburse API's uses HMAC credentials and, with the signature, provides identity verification and in-transit data integrity. To generate a HMAC for your requests, please see our full step by step guide which can be found on our open source account under the [HMAC examples page](https://github.com/Imburse-Payments/hmac-examples) To complete the process you will need the `publicKey` and `privateKey` from a Client or Account API Token. To configurure the request header for HMAC, use `Authorization: Hmac {token}`.
You must replace {token} with your HMAC authentication token key.
# Access Control All API functions require an API token to authenticate - see [Authentication](#authentication). As part of the request when creating [Client API Tokens](#client-api-tokens), you can specify the `roles` available to the token. Each API operation documents the exact role required so you can taylor your tokens to specific roles if required. #### Client Roles Role name | Description -|- `client-read` | Read Clients `client-write` | Read and write Clients `client-token-read` | Read Client API Tokens `client-token-write` | Read and write Client API Tokens `client-whitelabel-write` | Read and write Client Whitelabel Settings `collection-scheme-read` | Read Collection Schemes `collection-scheme-write` | Read and write Collection Schemes `psp-configuration-read` | Read PSP Configurations `psp-configuration-write` | Read and write PSP Configurations #### Account Roles `Account API Tokens` are created by Imburse and cannot be changed. The `roles` assigned to these tokens are shown for reference only. Role name | Function -|- `account-read` | Read Accounts `account-token-read` | Read Account API Tokens `client-token-write` | Write Client API Tokens # Errors Imburse uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request. In general, codes in the **2xx** range indicate success, codes in the **4xx** range indicate an error that failed given the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was omitted, etc.), and codes in the **5xx** range indicate an error with Imburse's servers, Response Code | Meaning --------------| ------- 200 | **OK** - Everything worked as expected. 400 | **Bad Request** - The request was unacceptable, often due to missing a required parameter. 401 | **Unauthorized** - No valid API key provided. 402 | **Request Failed** - The parameters were valid but the request failed. 403 | **Forbidden** -- The request endpoint is not valid for your user or role. 404 | **Not Found** - The requested resource doesn't exist. 409 | **Conflict** - The request conflicts with another request (perhaps due to using the same idempotent key). 429 | **Too Many Requests** - Too many requests hit the API too quickly. We recommend an exponential backoff of your requests. 500, 502, 503, 504 | **Internal Server Error** - Something went wrong on Imburse's end. # Countries All API functions that reference a country will use the **ISO 3166-1 alpha-2** country code format. Use the list below to identify the country. Alpha 2 Code | Name -|- AF|Afghanistan AX|Åland AL|Albania DZ|Algeria AS|American Samoa AD|Andorra AO|Angola AI|Anguilla AQ|Antarctica AG|Antigua and Barbuda AR|Argentina AM|Armenia AW|Aruba AU|Australia AT|Austria AZ|Azerbaijan BS|Bahamas BH|Bahrain BD|Bangladesh BB|Barbados BY|Belarus BE|Belgium BZ|Belize BJ|Benin BM|Bermuda BT|Bhutan BO|Bolivia BQ|Bonaire, Sint Eustatius and Saba BA|Bosnia and Herzegovina BW|Botswana BV|Bouvet Island BR|Brazil IO|British Indian Ocean Territory BN|Brunei Darussalam BG|Bulgaria BF|Burkina Faso BI|Burundi KH|Cambodia CM|Cameroon CA|Canada CV|Cape Verde KY|Cayman Islands CF|Central African Republic TD|Chad CL|Chile CN|China CX|Christmas Island CC|Cocos (Keeling) Islands CO|Colombia KM|Comoros CG|Congo (Brazzaville) CD|Congo (Kinshasa) CK|Cook Islands CR|Costa Rica CI|Côte d'Ivoire HR|Croatia CU|Cuba CW|Curaçao CY|Cyprus CZ|Czech Republic DK|Denmark DJ|Djibouti DM|Dominica DO|Dominican Republic EC|Ecuador EG|Egypt SV|El Salvador GQ|Equatorial Guinea ER|Eritrea EE|Estonia ET|Ethiopia FK|Falkland Islands FO|Faroe Islands FJ|Fiji FI|Finland FR|France GF|French Guiana PF|French Polynesia TF|French Southern Territories GA|Gabon GM|Gambia GE|Georgia DE|Germany GH|Ghana GI|Gibraltar GR|Greece GL|Greenland GD|Grenada GP|Guadeloupe GU|Guam GT|Guatemala GG|Guernsey GN|Guinea GW|Guinea-Bissau GY|Guyana HT|Haiti HM|Heard Island and McDonald Islands HN|Honduras HK|Hong Kong HU|Hungary IS|Iceland IN|India ID|Indonesia IR|Iran IQ|Iraq IE|Ireland IM|Isle of Man IL|Israel IT|Italy JM|Jamaica JP|Japan JE|Jersey JO|Jordan KZ|Kazakhstan KE|Kenya KI|Kiribati KP|Korea, North KR|Korea, South KW|Kuwait KG|Kyrgyzstan LA|Laos LV|Latvia LB|Lebanon LS|Lesotho LR|Liberia LY|Libya LI|Liechtenstein LT|Lithuania LU|Luxembourg MO|Macao MK|Macedonia MG|Madagascar MW|Malawi MY|Malaysia MV|Maldives ML|Mali MT|Malta MH|Marshall Islands MQ|Martinique MR|Mauritania MU|Mauritius YT|Mayotte MX|Mexico FM|Micronesia MD|Moldova MC|Monaco NF|Norfolk Island MP|Northern Mariana Islands NO|Norway OM|Oman PK|Pakistan PW|Palau PS|Palestine PA|Panama PG|Papua New Guinea PY|Paraguay PE|Peru PH|Philippines PN|Pitcairn PL|Poland PT|Portugal PR|Puerto Rico QA|Qatar RE|Réunion RO|Romania RU|Russian Federation RW|Rwanda BL|Saint Barthélemy SH|Saint Helena KN|Saint Kitts and Nevis LC|Saint Lucia MF|Saint Martin (French part) PM|Saint Pierre and Miquelon VC|Saint Vincent and the Grenadines WS|Samoa SM|San Marino ST|Sao Tome and Principe SA|Saudi Arabia SN|Senegal RS|Serbia SC|Seychelles SL|Sierra Leone SG|Singapore SX|Sint Maarten (Dutch TM|Turkmenistan TC|Turks and Caicos Islands TV|Tuvalu UG|Uganda UA|Ukraine AE|United Arab Emirates GB|United Kingdom US|United States of America UM|United States Minor Outlying Islands UY|Uruguay UZ|Uzbekistan VU|Vanuatu VA|Vatican City VE|Venezuela VN|Vietnam VG|Virgin Islands, British VI|Virgin Islands, U.S. WF|Wallis and Futuna EH|Western Sahara YE|Yemen ZM|Zambia ZW|Zimbabwe # Currencies All API functions that reference a Currency Code will use the **ISO 4217 alphabetic code** format. Use the list below to identify the currency. Alphabetic Code | Name -|- CHF | Swiss Franc EUR | Euro GBP | Pound Sterling USD | United States Dollar

item.name: Authentication API Reference
item.description:
This API describes how to create a Bearer token for API.

It is based on the HMAC authentication scheme.

exec: var unsignedSignature = publicKey + ":" + nonce + ":" + timestamp + ":" + bodySignature;
var hmac = publicKey + ":" + nonce + ":" + timestamp + ":" + signedSignature;

- take - the amount of results in the page. Default us 20.
- name - filters by a name.

item.name: Providers API Reference
item.description:
*Payment Service Provider* (PSP) configuration objects hold the connnection details that Imburse needs to connect to your PSP. With these details, we can carry out instructions on your behalf - such as credit card authorization and/or settlement. PSP configuration objects allow you to manage your PSP configurations for a given client. The API allows you to create, retrieve, and update your configurations.

## The PSP configuration object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
pspType | string | The name of the PSP. Currently only `BrainTree` is supported with these operations.
configuration | [Configuration](#the-configuration-object) object | An object that represents the configuration for a PSP. The data in this object will vary depending on the `pspType`.

## The configuration object

This object will vary depending on the `pspType` the PSP configuration is for.

Listed below are the all the configuration types that are currently supported.

### The BrainTree configuration object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
merchantId | string | The `merchantId` for your BrainTree account
publicKey | string  | The `publicKey` for your BrainTree account
privateKey | string  | The `privateKey` for your BrainTree account

request.description:
# Description

Create a PSP configuration.

## Role required

`psp-configuration-write`

### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that will own the PSP Configuration

#### Request body

A JSON formatted object string.

Key name | Required | Description
--------- | ----------- | -----------
pspType | Yes | The name of the PSP. Either `BRAINTREE_CREDITCARD`, `BRAINTREE_PAYPAL`, or `PAYDIREKT_PAYDIREKT` is supported with these operations.
name | Yes | A unique name of this PSP Configuration. 
currencies | Yes | An array of currency ISO codes that this PSP configuration supports. `BRAINTREE_CREDITCARD` and `BRAINTREE_PAYPAL` support a single currency per configuration. `PAYDIREKT_PAYDIREKT` can support multiple.
configuration | Yes | A [Configuration](#the-configuration-object) object that represents the configuration for a PSP. The data in this object will vary depending on the `pspType`.

#### Description

Updates a PSP configuration.

#### Role required

`psp-configuration-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the PSP Configuration
pspConfigurationId | The id of the PSP Configuration to update

#### Request body

A JSON formatted object string.

Key name | Required | Description
--------- | ----------- | -----------
name | Yes | A unique name of this PSP Configuration. 
currencies | Yes | An array of currency ISO codes that this PSP configuration supports. `BRAINTREE_CREDITCARD` and `BRAINTREE_PAYPAL` support a single currency per configuration. `PAYDIREKT_PAYDIREKT` can support multiple.
configuration | Yes | A [Configuration](#the-configuration-object) object that represents the configuration for a PSP. The data in this object will vary depending on the `pspType`.

configuration | Yes | A [Configuration](#the-configuration-object) object that represents the configuration for a PSP. The data in this object will vary depending on the `pspType`.

item.name: Collection Schemes
item.description:
Collection Scheme objects allow you to perform updates to your payment scheme collection settings. The API allows you to create new schemes, and add or update scheme country settings. You can retrieve individual schemes as well as a list of all your schemes for a given client.

## The collection scheme object

The collection scheme object holds details about a collection scheme, and is the parent to one or many scheme settings.

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
id | guid | The unique identifier of the object
name | string | The scheme name 
schemeSettings | array | An array of `SchemeSetting` objects 

## The scheme setting object

The scheme settings object holds details that concern individual countries' available payment methods. 

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
id | guid | The unique identifier of the object
country | string | The country code this scheme setting will apply to
paymentMethods | array | An array of `PaymentMethod` objects 

## The payment method object

The payment method object holds details that concern a particular payment method's availablilty.

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
pspId | guid | The unique identifier of the PSP (Payment Service Provider) providing services to the payment method
paymentMethodType | string | The name of the payment payment. ie. `visa-debit`, `paypal`, etc.
enabled | bool | Boolean value that determines if this payment method is currently enabled. 
key | string | A composite value of `pspId` and `paymentMethodType`

request.description:
#### Description 

Creates a new collection scheme. This will also create a scheme setting for this scheme at the same time.

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes

#### Description 

Get a list to collection schemes

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes

#### Description 

Get a collection schemes

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes
schemeId | The id of the scheme to get

item.name: Get available payment methods for new scheme

request.description:
#### Description 

Gets a list of payment methods that are available for a given country code. 

Use this operation when creating a new scheme to find the available payment methods. 

Not all PSP's operate in all territories so this methods will return a list of all the payment methods available to you from the PSP's you have configured for your client.

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes
country | The country code that will filter the available payment methods

#### Description 

Updates a scheme.

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes
schemeId | The id of the scheme to be updated

#### Description 

Deletes a collection scheme.

**Note:** You cannot delete a scheme that still has scheme settings. Delete the individual scheme settings before deleting the scheme.

#### Role required

`collection-scheme-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
clientId | The id of the client that owns the schemes
schemeId | The id of the scheme to delete

#### Description

Gets a list of a tenant's Webhooks.

#### Role required

`client-webhook-read`

# Description

Creates a Webhook.

## Role required

`client-webhook-write`

#### Request body

A JSON formatted object string.

Key name | Required | Description
- | - | -
eventType | Yes | The event type that the webhook will be subscribing to.
url | Yes | The url of the webhook.
isEnabled | Yes | Sets if the webhook is enabled or not.

# Description

Updates a Webhook.

## Role required

`client-webhook-write`

### Params

Parameter | Description
- | -
clientId | The id of the client that own's the Webhook.
clientWebhookId | The id of the Webhook to update.

#### Request body

A JSON formatted object string.

Key name | Required | Description
- | - | -
eventType | Yes | The event type that the webhook will be subscribing to.
url | Yes | The url of the webhook.
isEnabled | Yes | Sets if the webhook is enabled or not.

# Description

Deletes a Webhook.

## Role required

client-webhook-write

### Params

Parameter | Description
- | -
clientId | The id of the client that own's the Webhook.
clientWebhookId | The id of the Webhook to delete.

item.name: Whitelabel API Reference
item.description:
Client objects allow you to perform updates to clients. The API allows you to create, delete, and update your clients. You can retrieve individual clients as well as a list of all your clients.

## The client object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
id | guid | The unique identifier of the object
name | string | The clients name 
address | [address](#the-address-object) object | The client address
whiteLabelSettings | [White Label document](#the-white-label-settings-object) object | The white label settings for the client. ie. logo, styling document etc.

## The address object

Attribute | Type | Description
-|-|-
streetAddress | string | First line of address
extendedAddress | string | Second line of an address if requried
locality | string | The locality / city
region | string | The region / state / county
postCode | string | The post code / zip code
country | string | The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code

request.description:
#### Description

Retrieves the a tenants white label settings.

#### Role Required

`client-read`

#### Description

Uploads a logo for the tenants white label settings.

#### Role required

`client-write`

#### Description

Uploads a styling document for the tenant's white label settings.

#### Role required

`client-write`

item.name: Payment Collection API Reference
item.description:
##### Request structure

The following endpoints to manage customers, with orders and payment instructions. While the style is RESTful in nature, the collect API is not a fully REST service.

In most cases entities have an `/audit-history` endpoint which can be used to diagnose changes or problems a customer may have settling a payment.

##### Error Handling

Validation errors will return a common `400 Bad Request` HTTP status code with a response body in a common format.

Property | Type | Description
- | - | -
`errors` | Array[string] | One or many standardized error codes representing the failure.

request.description:
The following endpoint will return the current state of a customer.

Customers don't need to be created and as such an authorized API user can query non-existent customers.

The customer is identified by a `customerRef` - A value provided from your own system to ours.
The following endpoint will return an unstructured list of customer events.

This is the first stage required to collect a payment.

An order must be given both a unique `customerRef` and `orderRef`. Both of these values are created and owned by you, the API consumer. In both cases the reference fields can be used query current status, view audit history or to cancel, void or reconcile payments.

#### Request Body

The following parameters are sent in JSON format.

Parameter | Type | Description
- | - | -
orderRef | string (50 char max) | A unique identifier used to group one or many payment instructions.
currency | ISO3 | The currency to collect the payment in.
country | ISO2 | The country in which the customer resides to localize payment options.
scheme | string | The identifier of the `Scheme` in which to use.

#### Validation errors

One or many of the following errors may be returned if there were issues validating the request.

Code | Description
- | - 
`CUSTOMER_REF_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference is required.
`CUSTOMER_REF_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 50 characters.
`CUSTOMER_REF_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.`.
`ORDER_REF_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference is required.
`ORDER_REF_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 50 characters.
`ORDER_REF_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.`.
`CURRENCY_IS_REQUIRED` | Currency is required.
`CURRENCY_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 3 characters.
`COUNTRY_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.`.
`COUNTRY_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 2 characters.
`SCHEME_IS_REQUIRED` | Scheme is required.
`SCHEME_FORMAT_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Scheme was not recognised as a valid `GUID`.

The following endpoint will return the current state of an order.

Orders must be created before they can be queried.

The order is identified by both a `customerRef` and an `orderRef`. Both of these values are provided from your own system to ours.

An `orderRef` needs to be unique to the customer but does not need to be globally unique.
The following endpoint will return an unstructured list of order events.

An order requires one or many payment instructions to be set up. These instructions act as a payment schedule and contain the amount to be collected, the open date and the due date of the collection.

An instruction must be given a unique `instructionRef` (unique to the customer's order). This reference can be used in the future to look up or make amendments to an instruction.

#### Request Body

The following parameters are sent in JSON format.

Parameter | Type | Description
- | - | -
instructionRef | string (50 char max) | A unique identifier used to represent a single payment instruction.
amount | Decimal | The amount to collect.
openDate | Date (YYYY-MM-DD) | The date in which a manual payment can be made from.
dueDate | Date (YYYY-MM-DD) | The date in which a manual payment is to be settled by, or if automated will be taken on.

#### Validation errors

One or many of the following errors may be returned if there were issues validating the request.

Code | Description
- | - 
`CUSTOMER_REF_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference is required.
`CUSTOMER_REF_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 50 characters.
`CUSTOMER_REF_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.`.
`ORDER_REF_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference is required.
`ORDER_REF_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 50 characters.
`ORDER_REF_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.`.
`INSTRUCTION_REF_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference is required.
`INSTRUCTION_REF_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 50 characters.
`INSTRUCTION_REF_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.`.
`AMOUNT_IS_REQUIRED` | Amount is required.
`AMOUNT_FORMAT_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Amount must be in decimal form.
`AMOUNT_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Amount must be greater than zero.
`OPEN_DATE_IS_REQUIRED` | Open Date is required.
`OPEN_DATE_FORMAT_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Due Date could not be read as a valid date.
`DUE_DATE_IS_REQUIRED` | Due Date is required.
`DUE_DATE_FORMAT_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Due Date could not be read as a valid date.

The following endpoint will return the current state of an instruction.

Instructions must be created before they can be queried.

The instruction is identified by a `customerRef`, an `orderRef` and an `instructionRef`. These values are provided from your own system to ours.

An `instructionRef` needs to be unique to the order but does not need to be globally unique.
The following endpoint will return an unstructured list of instruction events.

Once you have created an Order and an Instruction for a Customer you are ready to generate a customer payment token.

The following request will generate a single-use bearer token, allowing your customer to either capture a single payment (called a `DIRECT_SALE`) or to capture a customer's billing details (called `BILLING_DETAILS`) for recurring payments.

#### Request Body

The following parameters are sent in JSON format.

Parameter | Type | Description
- | - | -
customerRef | string (50 char max) | The unique reference used to represent a customer.
orderRef | string (50 char max) | The unique reference used to represent an order.
instructionRef | string (50 char max) | The unique reference used to represent a payment instruction.
capture | Type | `DIRECT_SALE` or `BILLING_DETAILS`.
successUri | string (128 char max) | The URI the user journey should be redirected to in the event of an off-site payment.
rejectedUri | string (128 char max) | The URI the user journey should be redirected to in the event of an off-site payment.
cancelledUri | string (128 char max) | The URI the user journey should be redirected to in the event of an off-site payment.

#### Validation errors

One or many of the following errors may be returned if there were issues validating the request.

Code | Description
- | - 
`CUSTOMER_REF_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference is required.
`CUSTOMER_REF_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 50 characters.
`CUSTOMER_REF_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.`.
`ORDER_REF_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference is required.
`ORDER_REF_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 50 characters.
`ORDER_REF_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.`.
`INSTRUCTION_REF_IS_REQUIRED` | Reference is required.
`INSTRUCTION_REF_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Reference has a maximum of 50 characters.
`INSTRUCTION_REF_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS` | Reference can only contain the following characters `a-z0-9-_.`.
`CAPTURE_IS_REQUIRED` | Capture is required.
`CAPTURE_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Capture must be either `DIRECT_SALE` or `BILLING_DETAILS`.
`SUCCESS_URI_IS_REQUIRED` | Success URI is required.
`SUCCESS_URI_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Success URI cannot exceed 128 characters.
`SUCCESS_URI_FORMAT_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Success URI format is invalid.
`REJECTED_URI_IS_REQUIRED` | Rejected URI is required.
`REJECTED_URI_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Rejected URI cannot exceed 128 characters.
`REJECTED_URI_FORMAT_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Rejected URI format is invalid.
`CANCELLED_URI_IS_REQUIRED` | Cancelled URI is required.
`CANCELLED_URI_LENGTH_OUT_OF_RANGE` | Cancelled URI cannot exceed 128 characters.
`CANCELLED_URI_FORMAT_NOT_RECOGNISED` | Cancelled URI format is invalid.

exec: var unsignedSignature = publicKey + ":" + nonce + ":" + timestamp + ":" + bodySignature;
var hmac = publicKey + ":" + nonce + ":" + timestamp + ":" + signedSignature;
